result.execSummary:
The defendant Timesha Omunique Bunn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges to apply for work and child care.

miscConds.notes: No violation that rise to the level of probable cause.

Complete a firearm safety course.
Complete an Anger Management Class and/or Counseling
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.
Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (Including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timesha Omunique Bunn

records.addlTxt: of Representation by Attorney Ruby De Leon, filed.

Defendant Timesha Omunique Bunn in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Timesha Omunique Bunn.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work and child care.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
- No violation that rise to the level of probable cause.
- Complete a firearm safety course.
- Complete an Anger Management Class and/or Counseling

- Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges (Including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant is to provide a DNA sample 
- Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Timesha Omunique Bunn in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Timesha Omunique Bunn.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer. Defense submitted counteroffer.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Timesha Omunique Bunn in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timesha Omunique Bunn appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests additional time to review discovery and receive offer.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-21-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Timesha Omunique Bunn in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Branch 13, RESERVE JUDGES, in Room 508 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/17/2022 @1p
